event: Early human ancestors inhabit the western Iberian Peninsula
Neolithic and Bronze Age cultures develop along Atlantic Iberia
Phoenician trading posts appear along the coast
Roman rule integrates the region as Lusitania
Roman authority collapses during Germanic invasions
Visigothic Kingdom controls much of Iberia
Muslim forces conquer most of Iberia, including Portugal
County of Portugal is established during the Reconquista
Kingdom of Portugal is recognized as independent
Reconquista in Portugal is completed with the capture of the Algarve
Crisis of succession secures Portuguese independence from Castile
Capture of Ceuta begins Portuguese overseas expansion
Bartolomeu Dias rounds the Cape of Good Hope
Vasco da Gama reaches India by sea
Portugal claims Brazil, expanding its Atlantic empire
Portuguese trading empire spans Africa, Asia, and South America
Portugal enters dynastic union with Spain
Portugal restores independence from Spanish rule
Lisbon earthquake devastates the capital and reshapes urban planning
Napoleonic invasion forces royal court to relocate to Brazil
Brazil declares independence, ending Portugalâ€™s largest colony
Monarchy is overthrown and a republic is proclaimed
Peaceful revolution ends authoritarian rule and empire
Portugal joins the European Economic Community
